h1: How Many Calories Are in a Chicken Sandwich?
assumptions: Grilled chicken breast (100g), whole wheat bun, lettuce, tomato, 1 tsp light mayo; no cheese or fries.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe, portion size, and preparation method. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard grilled chicken sandwich provides about 350 kcal and 30 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Use whole grain bun and skip mayo

faqs.q: How many calories are in a grilled chicken sandwich?
faqs.a: About 350 kcal for a standard grilled version with veggies and light mayo.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in a chicken sandwich?
faqs.a: Typically 30 g of protein from the chicken breast.

faqs.q: Does a chicken sandwich have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 800 mg due to bread, chicken, and condimentsâ€”watch if on a low-sodium diet.

faqs.q: How do fast-food chicken sandwiches compare?
faqs.a: They often have 400-600 kcal due to breading, frying, and sauces; grilled options are lower.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower-calorie chicken sandwich?
faqs.a: Yes, use lettuce wrap instead of bun and skip mayo to reduce by ~100 kcal.
